org.qbroker.common

Class DelimitedBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qbroker.common.DelimitedBuffer

  • public class DelimitedBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    DelimitedBuffer is a byte buffer for parsing delimited content. The delimiter can be defined at the beginning as SOT and/or at the end as EOT. However, EOT and SOT should never share any byte chars.
    Author:
    yannanlu@yahoo.com

    • Constructor Detail

      • DelimitedBuffer

        public DelimitedBuffer(int size,
               int offhead,
               java.lang.String sot,
               int offtail,
               java.lang.String eot)
        Parameters:
        size - the buffer size
        offhead - number of bytes to trim off the delimiter at the beginning
        sot - a hexString of the delimiter at the beginning
        offtail - number of bytes to trim off the delimiter at the end
        eot - a hexString of the delimiter at the end

    • Method Detail

      • scan

        public int scan(int offset,
       int length)
        It scans the byte array of the internal buffer for either EOT or SOT strings starting from offset up to its end defined by length. It returns the position immediately after the string. If position > 0, it is end of SOT. If position < 0, it is end of EOT. Otherwise, it returns 0, nothing found.

        It is ok not to define SOT and/or EOT. However, EOT and SOT must never share any same byte (no overlap) This method is NOT MT-Safe since it requires the global objects: sotPosition, eotPosition, buffer.
